snippet: CARLSON--Claudia, died at the Dawn Greene Hospice in her 59th year on January 6, 2016. Claudia was born in Bloomington, Indiana to Elof and Helen (nee Zuckerman) Carlson and raised in six college towns. She was an illustrator, graphic designer, book designer, cartographer, photographer, and poet. She wrote three books of poetry, co-edited one volume of poetry, and wrote and illustrated a children's book. She worked for Farrar, Straus and Giroux, Oxford University Press, and American Friends of Magen David Adom. She also was a founding member of River Writers of Manhattan. She received her BA at Stony Brook University. After her mother's death she was raised by her father and Nedra (nee Miller) Carlson with her younger siblings, Christina, Erica, John and Anders. With David Allen she had two children Natalie (nee Allen) Hardaker, and Caitlin Allen. She is also survived by her husband, playwright James Racheff. A memorial service is planned for early spring. Condolences can be sent to: claudiacarlson@gmail.com 1/3
